documents.title: Dashboard Overview
documents.content:
The Dashboard is your central hub for monitoring organizing activities. It provides role-specific views:

**For Organisers**: View patch summary cards showing projects, EBA coverage, and worker metrics for your assigned patches.

**For Co-ordinators**: Access team oversight with expandable patch details for all organisers you manage.

**For Admins**: See system-wide metrics with hierarchical drill-down capabilities.

The dashboard includes filtering by tier (1, 2, 3), stage (construction, pre-construction, future, archived), organizing universe (active, potential, excluded), and EBA status.

documents.title: Using Dashboard Filters
documents.content:
Dashboard filters allow you to focus on specific subsets of projects:

**Tier Filter**: Select Tier 1, 2, 3, or 'All' to see projects by value classification.

**Stage Filter**: Choose Construction, Pre-construction, Future, or Archived to view projects by their lifecycle stage.

**Universe Filter**: Select Active (target projects), Potential (pipeline), or Excluded to filter by organizing strategy.

**EBA Filter**: Filter by Builder EBA Active, Builder EBA Inactive, or Builder Unknown to focus on agreement coverage.

Filters persist across page navigation and are stored in your session.
steps: Open the filters bar at the top of the dashboard
Select your desired filter criteria
Click 'Apply' or filters auto-apply
View filtered metrics in cards below
Clear filters by clicking 'Reset Filters'

documents.title: Creating a New Project
documents.content:
To create a new project, you'll enter essential information that helps classify and organize the construction work.

Projects are automatically classified into the Organizing Universe based on tier rules, but you can manually override if needed.
steps: Navigate to the Projects page (/projects)
Click the 'New Project' button in the top right
Enter the project name (required)
Enter the project address or select from map
Enter the estimated project value
Select or auto-assign project tier based on value
Add proposed start and finish dates
Select the builder if known
Review the auto-assigned organizing universe
Click 'Create Project' to save
You'll be redirected to the project detail page where you can add more information
prerequisites: Must have organiser, lead_organiser, or admin role
tips: Project tier auto-assigns: Tier 1 if value > $50M, Tier 2 if $10M-$50M, Tier 3 if < $10M
Organizing universe auto-assigns: Tier 1 → Active, Tier 2 → Active or Potential based on stage
You can change tier and universe manually after creation

documents.title: Registering a Site Delegate or HSR
documents.content: The delegate registration workflow allows you to register elected site delegates and Health & Safety Representatives with the CFMEU. This is a 4-step guided process that ensures all required information is captured and submitted correctly.
steps: Navigate to a project and go to the 'Mapping Sheets' tab
In the 'Site Contacts' section, find the 'Site Delegate' or 'Site HSR' row
Click 'Add Representative' (or 'Register' if someone is already assigned)
**Step 1 - Worker Selection**: Search for the worker from the project's worker list, or click 'Add New Worker' to create a new worker record
**Step 2 - Worker Details**: Review and update the worker's contact information (mobile, email, address are required for CFMEU submission)
**Step 3 - Registration Details**: Select the employer, choose representative type (Delegate Only, OHS Rep Only, or Both), and enter election information (elected by, date elected)
**Step 4 - Review & Submit**: Review all information and click 'Submit to CFMEU' to complete registration
The worker is now assigned the delegate/HSR role and their information is submitted to CFMEU NSW
prerequisites: Project must exist with assigned employers
You must have organiser or higher permissions
Worker must have mobile and email for CFMEU submission
tips: You can register multiple delegates for the same site
Both Delegate and HSR roles can be assigned to the same worker
Election information is required for CFMEU records
If the worker isn't on the project yet, use 'Add New Worker' to create their record first

documents.title: Understanding Mapping Sheets
documents.content:
Mapping Sheets are the central tool for tracking all contractors and trades on a construction project. They provide a comprehensive view of who is working on site, their EBA status, and trade classifications.

**Key Components:**

**Contractor Roles**: Shows the builder, project manager, and other primary contractors with their EBA status.

**Trade Contractors**: Organized by construction stage:
- Early Works (demolition, earthworks, piling)
- Structure (concrete, steel, formwork)
- Finishing (electrical, plumbing, painting)
- Other (general construction, plant)

**Site Contacts**: Lists delegates, HSRs, site managers, and foreman with quick registration actions.

**Data Sources**: Mapping sheets intelligently combine data from project assignments, trade records, and imports to show a complete picture.
tips: Auto-matched contractors from imports show a confidence indicator
You can print mapping sheets for site visits
Share links allow external parties to update information securely

documents.title: Importing BCI Project Data
documents.content: The BCI Import tool allows you to import construction project data from Building Construction Information (BCI) CSV or Excel files. The system intelligently processes company data and classifies contractors by role and trade type.
steps: Navigate to Admin → Data Upload
Click 'BCI Import'
Upload your BCI CSV or Excel file (must contain 'Project' and 'Company' sheets)
The worker processes the file and returns normalized data
Review the project list - projects are auto-classified by stage and value
Review company classifications (builder, head contractor, subcontractor)
Review employer matching suggestions
For fuzzy matches, confirm or reject each match
For new employers, confirm creation
Click 'Import' to create projects and relationships
View import summary showing created projects and contractor assignments
prerequisites: Must have lead_organiser or admin role
BCI file must follow standard template format
tips: The system filters out non-construction companies (engineers, consultants)
Trade types are inferred from company names (e.g., 'ABC Cranes' → tower_crane)
Exact name matches are auto-confirmed, fuzzy matches require review
You can merge duplicate employers during the import process

documents.title: Tracking Enterprise Bargaining Agreements
documents.content:
EBA (Enterprise Bargaining Agreement) tracking monitors the status of workplace agreements across all employers.

**EBA Milestones:**
- **Signed**: Agreement signed by parties
- **Lodged**: Submitted to Fair Work Commission
- **Certified**: Approved by FWC (active status)
- **Expired**: Past nominal expiry date

**EBA Status Colors:**
- Green: Active certified agreement
- Yellow: Signed or lodged but not certified
- Red: Expired or no agreement

**FWC Lookup**: Automated search of Fair Work Commission database to find and update employer EBA records (runs via scraper worker).
tips: EBA expiry alerts show in dashboard for agreements expiring within 6 weeks, 3 months, and 6 months
FWC lookup can be run manually for specific employers or in bulk
EBA status appears on mapping sheets to highlight coverage gaps

documents.title: Running FWC Lookup
documents.content: FWC Lookup automatically searches the Fair Work Commission database for enterprise agreements associated with employers.
steps: Navigate to Employers page
Select employers to search (or run for all)
Click 'FWC Lookup' action
Job is queued and processed by scraper worker
Monitor job progress in the status indicator
When complete, review found agreements
EBA records are automatically created/updated with certification dates, expiry dates, and FWC document links
prerequisites: Must have lead_organiser or admin role
Employers must have valid ABN or company name

documents.title: Understanding Campaigns and Activities
documents.content:
Campaigns are coordinated organizing efforts with tracked activities, worker participation, and measurable objectives.

**Campaign Structure:**
- Campaign (overall effort, e.g., 'CBD Tower Campaign 2025')
- Activities (specific actions within campaign)
- Worker Universe (workers included in activity)
- Rating Definitions (1-5 scale: supportive leader → anti-leader)
- Objectives & Targets (measurable goals)

**Activity Types:**
- Site visit conversations
- Union meetings
- One-on-one discussions
- Group actions
- Custom activity types

**Scoping**: Activities can be scoped to specific projects, employers, or job sites. The worker universe is built from placements matching the scope.
tips: Rating definitions are customizable per activity
Worker universe auto-populates based on selected scope (projects/employers/sites)
Objectives can target overall numbers or specific subgroups

documents.title: Creating a Campaign Activity
documents.content: The Activity Builder creates tracked organizing activities within a campaign.
steps: Open a campaign from the Campaigns page
Click 'New Activity'
Select activity date
Choose activity type (e.g., 'site visit', 'meeting', 'one-on-one')
Enter call to action (what you're asking workers to do)
Select scope: Choose projects, employers, or job sites
Preview worker universe (auto-populated from selected scope)
Define rating scale: Enter definitions for levels 1-5 (1=supportive leader, 5=anti-leader)
Optionally add objectives with target values
Click 'Create Activity'
Activity is created with all workers added to tracking list
Navigate to activity detail to record worker conversations and ratings
prerequisites: Scope entities (projects/employers/sites) must have worker placements
tips: Worker universe preview shows count before creation
Rating definitions help maintain consistency across multiple organisers
Objectives can be numeric (e.g., 10 conversations) or percentage (e.g., 75% positive)

documents.title: Organizing Universe Auto-Assignment Rules
documents.content:
The Organizing Universe classifies projects into Active, Potential, or Excluded based on tier and stage.

**Auto-Assignment Rules:**
- **Tier 1**: Always Active (regardless of stage)
- **Tier 2 Construction**: Active
- **Tier 2 Pre-construction**: Potential
- **Tier 2 Future/Archived**: Potential
- **Tier 3 Construction**: Potential
- **Tier 3 Pre-construction**: Potential
- **Tier 3 Future/Archived**: Excluded

**Manual Override**: You can manually change any project's organizing universe. When you do, it's marked as 'manually set' and won't be auto-updated by rule changes.

**Retrospective Application**: When rules change, existing projects are updated unless they have manual overrides.

technical.trigger: on INSERT or UPDATE of projects

documents.title: Managing Organiser Patches
documents.content:
Patches are geographic areas assigned to organisers for organizing work.

**Patch Features:**
- Geographic boundaries (GeoJSON polygons)
- Project assignment based on job site locations
- Organiser assignment (multiple organisers can share a patch)
- Interactive map visualization

**Managing Patches:**
- Co-ordinators can assign organisers to patches via the Lead Console (/lead)
- Admins can create new patches and draw boundaries via Spatial Assignment (/admin)
- Projects are automatically associated with patches based on job site coordinates

**Patch View (/patch):**
- Shows all projects within patch boundaries
- Displays patch metrics (total projects, EBA coverage, workers)
- Interactive map with project locations
- Quick actions for site visits and worker lists
tips: Patch boundaries can be uploaded as GeoJSON files
Projects can belong to multiple patches if job sites span boundaries
Organisers see only their assigned patches by default

documents.title: Creating Secure Share Links
documents.content: Share Links allow you to grant temporary access to specific project information for external users (like delegates) without requiring platform login.
steps: Navigate to a project's Mapping Sheets tab
Click 'Share Mapping Sheet' button
Select expiry time (24h, 48h, 72h, or 1 week)
Click 'Generate Link'
Copy the secure URL (e.g., https://app.cfmeu.org/share/abc123...)
Send link to delegate or external party
They can access the form without login
Form pre-fills with project data
External user can update information and submit
Token is marked as 'used' after submission

security.singleUse: Token marked as used after form submission
security.resourceScoping: Access limited to specific project mapping sheet

tips: Links expire automatically after the set time
You can generate multiple links for the same project
Used tokens show submission timestamp in admin view

documents.title: Syncing Incolink Worker Data
documents.content: Incolink sync imports worker placement data from the Incolink redundancy scheme, automatically creating worker records and linking them to employers and projects.
steps: Navigate to Admin → Data Upload
Click 'Incolink Sync'
Enter Incolink credentials (stored securely)
Select employers to sync (or run for all)
Job is queued and processed by scraper worker
Worker scrapes Incolink for placement data
New workers are created automatically
Existing workers are matched by name/details
Placements are created linking workers to employers
Review sync summary showing created/matched workers and placements
prerequisites: Must have lead_organiser or admin role

technical.matching: Fuzzy name matching with confidence scoring

documents.title: User Roles and Permissions
documents.content:
The platform has 5 user roles with different permission levels:

**Admin**
- Full system access
- User management and role assignment
- System configuration and navigation control
- Hierarchy management
- All data import/export functions
- System health monitoring

**Lead Organiser (Co-ordinator)**
- Team management within assigned area
- Organiser patch assignment
- Data upload (BCI, EBA, Workers, Employers)
- Invite new organisers
- View all team activities
- Duplicate employer resolution

**Organiser**
- Manage assigned patch(es)
- Create and edit projects
- Log site visits
- Update mapping sheets
- Register delegates
- Create campaigns and activities
- Worker data import (limited)

**Delegate**
- View assigned projects and sites
- Update worker information
- View mapping sheets (read-only)

**Viewer**
- Read-only access to projects, employers, workers
- View dashboard metrics
- No editing capabilities

documents.title: Troubleshooting Import Errors
documents.content:
Common import errors and solutions:

**Template Mismatch Error**
- Cause: CSV/Excel doesn't match expected format
- Solution: Re-export from source using standard template, ensure column headers match exactly

**Worker Not Running**
- Cause: Railway worker is offline
- Solution: Check Railway dashboard, restart worker if needed

**Duplicate Employer**
- Cause: Employer already exists with same ABN
- Solution: Use 'Merge Employers' function to consolidate duplicates before import

**Invalid Date Format**
- Cause: Dates not in expected format
- Solution: Ensure dates are DD/MM/YYYY or ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD)

**File Too Large**
- Cause: File exceeds 1MB limit (BCI worker)
- Solution: Split file into smaller batches or filter data

**Authorization Error**
- Cause: User lacks required role
- Solution: Verify you have lead_organiser or admin role

documents.title: Site Visit Wizard Overview
documents.content: The Site Visit Wizard is a mobile-optimized interface that streamlines the entire site visit process for field organisers. It provides a two-phase interface with geolocation-based project detection and quick action selection.
steps: Open project page on mobile device
Tap floating Site Visit Wizard button
Select or confirm current project location
Choose visit reason from action menu
Complete workflow steps with auto-save

documents.title: Installing the Mobile PWA
documents.content: Install the CFMEU Organiser app as a Progressive Web App (PWA) on your mobile device for offline capability and native app experience. The PWA works offline, sends push notifications, and provides access to device features.
steps: iOS: Open Safari, navigate to app URL, tap Share → Add to Home Screen
Android: Open Chrome, look for Install icon in address bar
Tap Install/Add to complete installation
Grant requested permissions (Location, Camera, Notifications)
Open app from home screen icon

documents.title: Mobile Dashboard Navigation
documents.content: The mobile dashboard provides touch-optimized navigation with bottom tab bar, swipe gestures, and large touch targets designed for construction site use. Features include patch cards, quick actions, and responsive layout.

documents.title: Site Visit Mapping Workflow
documents.content: Complete workflow for mapping project workforce, identifying employers, and registering union delegates during site visits. Includes photo capture, voice notes, and offline capability.
steps: Start Site Visit Wizard and select Mapping workflow
Document total workforce count and trade breakdown
Identify and record primary contractor and subcontractors
Map union members and potential delegates
Capture photos and add voice notes as evidence
Review and submit with auto-save protection

documents.title: Site Visit Compliance Audit Workflow
documents.content: Mobile-optimized compliance audit workflow with traffic light rating system, sham contracting detection, and evidence capture. Includes CBUS/Incolink verification and automated compliance checks.
steps: Start Site Visit Wizard and select Compliance Audit
Complete 4-point traffic light rating assessment
Check CBUS payment compliance and timeliness
Verify Incolink payments and superannuation
Assess sham contracting risk indicators
Document evidence with photos and notes
Submit automated rating with confidence scoring

documents.title: Ratings System v2 Overview
documents.content: Advanced employer assessment framework combining quantitative project data analysis (70% weight) with qualitative organiser expertise (30% weight). Features evidence-based weighting, confidence scoring, and sham contracting protection.

technical.scoring: Traffic light system with confidence levels

documents.title: Sham Contracting Detection
documents.content: Automated sham contracting detection system with 'hard block' features that prevent green ratings for non-compliant employers. Includes pattern recognition, evidence requirements, and audit trails.
steps: Complete compliance audit or expertise assessment
Locate sham contracting detection section
Toggle detection switch for identified concerns
Provide detailed evidence with specific examples
Attach supporting documentation and photos
Submit with automatic rating cap applied

documents.title: Delegate Task Management System
documents.content: System for assigning tasks to union delegates through secure webforms. Features task creation, assignment, progress tracking, and completion verification with mobile-optimized delegate interface.
steps: Create task from campaign or project page
Select delegate(s) for assignment
Configure task requirements and deadlines
Generate secure webform link
Delegate receives task and completes via mobile form
Track progress and verify completion

documents.title: Offline Usage and Data Sync
documents.content: Comprehensive offline capability allowing full functionality without internet connection. Features intelligent data caching, automatic sync queue, conflict resolution, and background updates.

technical.cachePolicy: Intelligent prefetch based on user assignments

documents.title: GPS and Location-Based Features
documents.content: Location-based features including 'Closest to me' project discovery, turn-by-turn navigation, geofencing alerts, and automatic site check-in. Works offline with cached location data.
steps: Enable location services when prompted
Use 'Closest to me' to find nearby projects
Tap project pin for quick actions and navigation
Automatic check-in when entering project geofence
View distance calculations in real-time

documents.title: Mobile Camera and Photo Features
documents.content: Mobile-optimized camera integration for evidence capture during site visits. Features automatic photo compression, timestamping, geotagging, and organization by project and category.

documents.title: Voice Input and Dictation
documents.content: Voice input capabilities for hands-free data entry on construction sites. Supports dictation for notes, worker comments, and observations with automatic transcription and editing.

documents.title: Mobile Form Optimization
documents.content: Touch-optimized forms with large buttons (minimum 44px), auto-save every 30 seconds, voice input support, and intelligent validation. Designed for construction site use with gloves and varying light conditions.

documents.title: Mobile Quick Start Guide (5 Minutes)
documents.content: Rapid onboarding guide for new field organisers. Covers PWA installation, first login, dashboard overview, finding closest project, and completing first site visit using the Site Visit Wizard.
steps: Install PWA on your mobile device (2 minutes)
Sign in and grant permissions (1 minute)
Review dashboard and patch assignments (1 minute)
Find closest project using GPS (30 seconds)
Complete first site visit with wizard (2 minutes)

documents.title: Mobile Rating Assessment Workflow
documents.content: Mobile-first rating workflow with touch-optimized interface, real-time confidence scoring, and instant feedback. Features simplified controls for construction site use and offline capability.
steps: Access rating form from employer or project page
Complete Track 1: Project Data Analysis (auto-populated)
Complete Track 2: Organiser Expertise Assessment
Review calculated rating with confidence score
Address any sham contracting alerts if present
Submit with automatic sync when online

documents.title: Incolink Integration (Mobile View)
documents.content: Mobile-optimized interface for Incolink data synchronization. View sync status, trigger updates, and review worker placement matches from mobile devices with progress indicators.

documents.title: FWC EBA Lookup (Mobile View)
documents.content: Mobile interface for Fair Work Commission EBA searches. Monitor lookup progress, review found agreements, and update employer records from mobile devices with real-time status updates.

documents.title: Troubleshooting Mobile Issues
documents.content: Common mobile issues and solutions: PWA installation problems, GPS not working, offline sync failures, camera permissions, and performance optimization. Includes device-specific troubleshooting for iPhone and Android.

documents.title: Troubleshooting Offline and Sync Issues
documents.content: Detailed troubleshooting for offline functionality: sync queue stuck, storage full, data conflicts, background sync not working, and connectivity issues. Includes manual sync options and data recovery procedures.
steps: Check network connectivity status
Review sync queue for stuck items
Clear browser cache if storage is full
Manually trigger sync if needed
Restart app if background sync fails
Contact support for data recovery if needed

documents.title: Troubleshooting Sham Contracting Detection
documents.content: Guide for handling sham contracting detection issues: false positives, evidence requirements, appeals process, dispute resolution, and clearing incorrect flags. Includes documentation standards and review procedures.

documents.title: Mobile Security and Privacy Features
documents.content: Mobile security features including secure token storage, encrypted offline data, biometric authentication, permission management, and secure data transmission. Covers GDPR compliance and data privacy protections.

documents.title: Mobile Accessibility Features
documents.content: Accessibility features for mobile users: screen reader support, voice navigation, high contrast mode, large text options, haptic feedback, and reduced motion settings. Designed for users with varying accessibility needs.
